meaning: Scenario label used for output folder naming and for joining results later.
notes: Must be unique. Short and filesystem safe.

meaning: Number of time points t = 1,…,T at level 1. Controls length of time series for all variables.
notes: Larger T increases file size and runtime.

meaning: Number of level 1 spatial units j = 1,…,n1. Determines graph size and coarsest counts dimension.
notes: Choose to mimic your real spatial resolution.

meaning: Number of levels in the multiscale tree. Level 1 is the coarsest in this generator, levels 2…L are finer splits.
notes: If L = 1 no splitting is done.

type: integer vector or comma separated list
meaning: Children per refined node at each splitting level. Length must equal L minus 1. Example for L=3: "4,3".
notes: If refine_prob < 1, not all nodes split, so actual children counts can vary.

meaning: Probability that a node is refined, at each nonterminal level. Implements mixed resolution trees by leaving some nodes as leaves early.
notes: Set to 1 for fully balanced tree, less than 1 for partial refinement.

meaning: Adjacency structure for the ICAR prior at level 1. Options in current code: grid or ring.
notes: Grid builds a near square lattice with 4 neighbors, ring builds a cyclic chain.

meaning: ICAR precision parameter for spatial effects φ. Larger values shrink φ toward zero, smaller values create larger spatial variability.
notes: Adjacency controls smoothness pattern, tau_phi controls magnitude.

meaning: Negative binomial overdispersion control via kappa_{t,j} ~ Gamma(r_size, r_size). Mean 1, variance 1 / r_size.
notes: Smaller r_size means stronger overdispersion, larger r_size approaches Poisson.

meaning: Dirichlet concentration for split probabilities ω_{t,lj} ~ Dirichlet(alpha_dir * q_{t,lj}). Controls how noisy ω is around q.
notes: Smaller alpha_dir gives more variable splits across time.

meaning: Temporal discount factor governing dynamics of residual risk λ_tilde under discount evolution. Values near 1 produce slow change, smaller values produce faster change.
notes: In the current generator, mode is discount. gamma=1 makes λ_tilde constant after t=1.

meaning: Number of covariates per spatial unit and time point. x is generated as an array T by n1 by p.
notes: Must match length of beta_vals.

meaning: Intercept in the log mean model at level 1: log μ includes beta0 + xβ + φ.
notes: Adjusts overall incidence level together with exposures.

type: numeric vector or comma separated list
meaning: Regression coefficients for covariates. Length must equal p.
notes: Represented in csv as a single string.

meaning: Standard deviation for covariate generation: x_{t,j,k} ~ Normal(0, x_sd^2).
notes: Increase to widen covariate effect variation.

meaning: Mean of log exposure: log e_{t,j} ~ Normal(loge_mean, loge_sd^2). So e is log normal.
notes: Controls expected exposure magnitude. Interacts with beta0.

meaning: Standard deviation of log exposure for e. Controls exposure heterogeneity.
notes: Set to 0 for constant exposures.

meaning: Optional zero inflation misspecification applied after Poisson draw at level 1. With probability zi_prob, y_{t,j} is set to 0.
notes: This is a misspecification switch, not part of the core MSSTNB DGP.

meaning: How the baseline compositions q_{t,lj} evolve over time before drawing ω. Options: static, drift, changepoint.
notes: Controls time variation in multiscale allocation proportions.

meaning: Change point time index used when comp_mode is changepoint. If 0, no change point is applied. If positive, change applies for t > cp_time.
notes: Must satisfy 1 ≤ cp_time < T to have an effect.

meaning: Strength of composition change at the change point. Implemented by spiking one randomly chosen component of q by multiplying it by cp_strength then renormalizing.
notes: Larger values create a larger regime shift.

meaning: Drift scale for comp_mode drift. Applies multiplicative log normal perturbations to q each time step, then renormalizes.
notes: Larger values create faster composition drift.

meaning: Number of Monte Carlo replicates to generate for this scenario.
notes: Each replicate uses seed_base + rep_id.

meaning: Base random seed for this scenario. Replicate r uses seed_base + r plus fixed offsets for subcomponents to reduce coupling.
notes: Change seed_base to regenerate an independent set of replicates.
